page.title: 17A WALK NEAR HARTHILL
page.content: Down by the canal we went,the rain pouring,the mud getting more sludgy as our 6-mile walk began. Puddles started to get bigger, and the splashes on the surface of the canal looked sharp and fierce. Now and again a coal train would go past nearby.In some of the clear bits of the canal I could see the shadows of some pikes.We went under a few bridges, one called Devil's Hole Bridge (I've still to find out why it's called that) and we saw quite a few locks.I didn't feel all that wet but I was.Soon we reached Kiveton Park Station, then through more puddles, and eventually back to Harthill. Up the farmyard, down the street, back to school; into the warm classroom, and then it was letting water out of shoes time.
